newsitem.title: USA: UAL flight attendants to consider proposal.
newsitem.headline: UAL flight attendants to consider proposal.

text.p: United Airlines flight attendants' union said Thursday it agreed to a three-week recess in negotiations to allow it to consider a labour contract proposed by the carrier.
The Association of Flight Attendants (AFA), which represents 21,000 United attendants, has been in concentrated talks for the last month in Hawaii, a union spokeswoman said in an interview.
"At the request of a private mediator, the parties agreed to a three-week recess to allow AFA to consider a comprehensive company proposal," the AFA said in a statement received in Chicago.
"The parties have expressed satisfaction with the progress made in bargaining to date and look forward to resuming negotiations in Honolulu in early June," it said.
A United Airlines spokeswoman said, "We are pleased with the progress so far and look forward to resuming talks in June."
The contract ran out in March 1996. The last proposal was rejected on April 9, 1996, by the union's membership.
United is a unit of Chicago-based UAL Corp.
